intro: Tolumnia lucayana, commonly known as the Lucayan tolumnia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and mangrove ecosystems. Tolumnia lucayana plays a role in local biodiversity and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
